src.plot.plot

Helper functions for plotting model evaluation results.

src.plot.plot.make_and_save_plots(scores, name, save_path)[source]

Make and save plots.

Parameters:

  • scores – pd.DataFrame Scores from model evaluation.

  • name – str Name of model.

  • save_path – str Path to save plots.

Returns:

None

src.plot.plot.make_plot_data(scores)[source]

Make data for plots.

Parameters:

scores – pd.DataFrame of shape (n_splits, n_scores) Scores from model evaluation.

Returns:

tuple of dataframes Plot data.

src.plot.plot.plot_confusion_matrix(scores, name, save_path)[source]

Plot normalized confusion matrix using matplotlib.

Parameters:

  • scores – np.array of shape (2, 2) Confusion matrix scores.

  • name – str Name of model.

  • save_path – str Path to save plots.

Returns:

None

src.plot.plot.plot_test_calibration(holdout_scores, name, save_path)[source]

Plot calibration curve for holdout data.

Parameters:

  • holdout_scores – dict Scores from model evaluation.

  • name – str Name of model.

  • save_path – str Path to save plots.

Returns:

None

src.plot.plot.plot_train_calibration(prob_true, prob_pred, name, save_path)[source]

Plot calibration errors.

Parameters:

  • prob_true – pd.DataFrame of shape (n_splits, n_scores) True probabilities.

  • prob_pred – pd.DataFrame of shape (n_splits, n_scores) Predicted probabilities.

  • name – str Name of model.

  • save_path – str Path to save plots.

Returns:

None

src.plot.plot.test_plot()[source]

Test the plot style with a dummy plot.

Returns:

None
